AccessControlBadConfirmation().details: The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}.

AddressEmptyCode(address).details: There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract).

AddressInsufficientBalance(address).details: The ETH balance of the account is not enough to perform the operation.

ERC1967InvalidImplementation(address).details: The `implementation` of the proxy is invalid.

ERC1967NonPayable().details: An upgrade function sees `msg.value > 0` that may be lost.

EnforcedPause().details: The operation failed because the contract is paused.

ExpectedPause().details: The operation failed because the contract is not paused.

FailedInnerCall().details: A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted.

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

SafeERC20FailedOperation(address).details: An operation with an ERC20 token failed.

UUPSUnauthorizedCallContext().details: The call is from an unauthorized context.

UUPSUnsupportedProxiableUUID(bytes32).details: The storage `slot` is unsupported as a UUID.

Initialized(uint64).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

Paused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`.

RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.details: Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this.

RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call, an admin role bearer except when using {AccessControl-_setupRole}.

RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)

params.totalAmount: total amount staked by the validator

Unpaused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`.

Upgraded(address).details: Emitted when the implementation is upgraded.

acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

params.unstakeAmount: amount to sent to validator owner

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

ContributionRewardClaimed(address,uint25.notice: Triggered when a data contributor has claimed a reward

EpochCreated(uint256).notice: Triggered when a epoch has been created

EpochRewardAmountUpdated(uint256).notice: Triggered when the epoch reward amount has been updated

EpochRewardClaimed(address,uint256,uint2.notice: Triggered when a validator has claimed un unsed reward

EpochSizeUpdated(uint256).notice: Triggered when the epoch size has been updated

FileAdded(address,uint256).notice: Triggered when a file has been added

FileRewardDelayUpdated(uint256).notice: Triggered when the fileRewardDelay has been updated

FileRewardFactorUpdated(uint256).notice: Triggered when the fileRewardFactor has been updated

FileVerified(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Triggered when a file has been verified

MasterKeySet(string).notice: Triggered when a master key has been set

MaxNumberOfValidatorsUpdated(uint256).notice: Triggered when the max number of validators has been updated

MinStakeAmountUpdated(uint256).notice: Triggered when the minStakeAmount has been updated

Staked(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Triggered when a validator has staked some DAT

Unstaked(address,uint256).notice: Triggered when a validator has unstaked some DAT

ValidationPeriodUpdated(uint256).notice: Triggered when the validation period has been updated

ValidatorApproved(address).notice: Triggered when a validator has been approved

ValidatorDeregistered(address).notice: Triggered when a validator has been deregistered

ValidatorDeregisteredByOwner(address,uin.notice: Triggered when a validator has been deregistered by the dlp owner

ValidatorRegistered(address,address,uint.notice: Triggered when a validator has registered

ValidatorScoreKappaUpdated(uint256).notice: Triggered when the validatorScoreKappa has been updated

ValidatorScoreMinTrustUpdated(uint256).notice: Triggered when the validatorScoreMinTrust has been updated

ValidatorScoreRhoUpdated(uint256).notice: Triggered when the validatorScoreRho has been updated

ValidatorUnregistered(address).notice: Triggered when a validator has been unregistered

WeightsUpdated(address,address[],uint256.notice: Triggered when a validator has updated its weights

activeValidatorsLists(uint256).notice: Get active validator list by listId

addFile(string,string).notice: Add a file to the pool

createEpochs().notice: Create epochs used when the last epoch has ended

createEpochsUntilBlockNumber(uint256).notice: Create epochs used when the last epoch has ended

deregisterValidatorByOwner(address,uint2.notice: Deregister validator and withdraw stake amount

fileScores(uint256,address).notice: Get the file scores for a validator

getEmissionScores(uint256).notice: Get the emission scores for the validators

getNextFileToVerify(address).notice: Get the next file to verify

rationalSigmoid(uint256,uint256,uint256,.notice: Set the emission scores for the validators Approximate sigmoid function using rational approximation and WAD Modeled after https://bittensor.com/whitepaper Designed via https://www.desmos.com/calculator/npx9o19sre

updateMaxNumberOfValidators(uint256).notice: Update the maximum number of validators

updateWeights(address[],uint256[]).notice: Set the weights for the validators

validatorWeights(address).notice: Get weights assigned by the validator

version().notice: return the version of the contract
